data.title: Prince William and Prince Harry Feud Timeline
data.meta_description: Here's a complete timeline of Prince Harry and Prince William's royal feudâ€”from their fight about Meghan Markle to where they stand today.
data.text:
In case you hadnâ€™t noticed, Prince William and Prince Harry are in a ğŸ—£ï¸ ROYAL FEUD. Or as some are calling it, a ğŸ—£ï¸ ROYAL RIFT. This drama has been going on forever, and chances are, youâ€™re vaguely confused. We all are! Because truly, what are they even fighting about and why canâ€™t everyone just get along? Things are still not the best because of Harry and Meghan Markleâ€™s 2020 tell-all interview with Oprahâ€¦and Meghanâ€™s bombshell 2022 interview with The Cut. On top of it all, the Sussexesâ€™ Netflix docuseries Harry & Meghan in December 2022 caused the royal family to spiral for literal weeks before the show was even available. But in the interest of living for trying to understand the drama, weâ€™ve put together a timeline of this brotherly spat. So letâ€™s go back, back to the beginningâ€”aka winter 2018.

November 2018

At this point, likely fictitious rumors of drama between Meghan Markle and Kate Middleton had already been floating around the internet for a bit. But then veteran royal reporter Katie Nicholl dropped the bombshell that it was actually Harry and William who hadnâ€™t been getting along. According to Katieâ€™s sources, the brothers had a falling out around Christmas 2018, when Harry told Will he wasnâ€™t doing enough to include Meghan in the royal family.

Per Nichollâ€™s source, â€œHarry felt William wasnâ€™t rolling out the red carpet for Meghan and told him so. They had a bit of a fallout, which was only resolved when Charles stepped in and asked William to make an effort. Thatâ€™s when the Cambridges invited the Sussexes to spend Christmas with them.â€

Youâ€™d think thatâ€™d be the end of things, but HA HA HA, please. Weâ€™ve only just begun.

December 2018

The Sussexes and Cambridges spent Christmas together in Sandringham with the Queen, but unfortunately, royal watchers discovered a video of William seemingly ignoring Meghan during the familyâ€™s walk. Basically, she tried to talk to him and he spent a ton of time adjusting his scarf instead of responding.

February 2019

Truly a woof month for the royal fam. Mostly because TLC started promoting its not-at-all-dramatic documentary, Kate v. Meghan: Princesses at War? Iâ€™ll give you a moment to side-eye the universe. During the doc, Katie Nicholl explained, â€œWilliam was quite concerned that the relationship had moved so quickly. And being close to Harry, probably the only person close enough to say to Harry, This seems to be moving quickly, are you sure?â€™â€

She continued, â€œI think what was meant as well-intended brotherly advice just riled Harry. Harry is hugely protective of Meghan. He saw that as criticism. He interpreted that as his brother not really being behind this marriage, this union, and I donâ€™t think things have been quite right ever since.â€

But wait, it gets more dramatic; The doc also featured a quote from the Sunâ€™s royal correspondent Emily Andrews, who claimed that Harry â€œwent ballistic and said, â€˜Youâ€™re trying to wreck this relationship before itâ€™s even started.â€™â€ This was probably the point at which the â€œroyal feudâ€ became the ROYAL FEUD.

March 2019

In March, royal filmmaker Nick Bullen confirmed to Fox News that Meghan and Kate were never at odds....it was always Prince William and Prince Harry. â€œItâ€™s actually that William and Harry have had a rift,â€ he said. â€œAll brothers fall out. All families fall out. Their fallout at the moment is becoming public.â€

April 2019

In an effort to find out what the literal hell was going on, Cosmopolitan spoke to Nicholl, who told us, â€œI donâ€™t know that things will ever be the way they were between William and Harry.â€

Womp. On top of that, the brothers attended an Easter service together and legit didnâ€™t speak. As People noted, â€œHarry was seen talking to [his cousin] Zara and exchanging pleasantries with Kate but did not say anything to his elder brother.â€ Yup, thereâ€™s a video:

May 2019

Things kinda seemed to be improving in May. By which I mean the Mirror dropped news that Kate and William visited Meghan and Harryâ€™s new house, Frogmore Cottage. Apparently, their hang sesh was an â€œolive branchâ€ between the brothers, and Kate urged Harry to extend the invitation because she was â€œacutely aware of the importance of William and Harry getting along, not just because of perception but their collective responsibility to the monarchy as a whole.â€

Plus, we got a video of Kate being super stoked about Meghan and Harryâ€™s baby:

June 2019

So, this is when Meghan and Harry officially split from the joint charity they shared with Kate and William. It was honestly just a logistical decision and had nothing to do with drama, but that didnâ€™t stop everyone from reading into it.

Awkwardly, June also happened to be the month we found out that William and Harry fully werenâ€™t speaking before Archieâ€™s birth thanks to Nicholl telling ET, â€œI was told by a very senior royal source that actually they werenâ€™t talking to each other at one point. I certainly think now that Archie is here, it has probably really helped to improve the relationship. William is over the moon that his brother is a dad.â€

July 2019

Positive update! William and Kate joined Meghan and Harry for Archieâ€™s christening and they took a group photo. Negative update! William made a weird face and everyone thought he was unhappy to be there:

Oh, and an Us Weekly source revealed that William and Kate â€œwerenâ€™t happy aboutâ€ Meghan and Harryâ€™s decision to keep the christening private and â€œWilliam thinks his brother is going overboard keeping Archie out of the spotlightâ€ and â€œblames Meghan.â€

August 2019

Sources claimed that William and Harry planned to put their differences aside to remember their mother Princess Diana on August 31, the anniversary of her death. â€œThey talk about the little things about Diana that made them laugh: the ski trips and outings to Thorpe Park [a British amusement park]; the effort she went to on their birthdays...all of it,â€ a source told Us Weekly, adding that Kate Middleton and Meghan Markle planned to â€œjoin them later.â€

October 2019

Good olâ€™ October. Otherwise known as the month Prince Harry broke the internet and admitted there was, in fact, a royal rift. â€œPart of this role and part of this job, and this family, being under the pressure that itâ€™s under, inevitably, you know, stuff happens,â€ he said when asked about the rumored feud during ITVâ€™s documentary Harry & Meghan: An African Journey. â€œBut look, weâ€™re brothers, weâ€™ll always be brothers. And weâ€™re certainly on different paths at the moment, but Iâ€™ll always be there for him, as I know heâ€™ll always be there for me.â€

He continued, â€œWe donâ€™t see each other as much as we used to because weâ€™re so busy, but you know, I love him dearly. The majority of this stuff [in the press] is created out of nothing, but you know, as brothers, you know, you have good days, you have bad days.â€

At this point, a source told Us Weekly that Kate hated seeing Meghan and Harry â€œso miserableâ€ and hoped â€œWilliam and Harry will eventually heal the rift and let bygones be bygones. The way she sees it, lifeâ€™s too short to make enemiesâ€”especially with loved ones. Sheâ€™s very levelheaded like that. Kateâ€™s a family girl.â€

November 2019

The month kicked off with a source telling Us Weekly that things are still â€œnot greatâ€ for Harry and William and that â€œthey both need to put in the effort to rebuild their relationship.â€

Awkward, because the Palace revealed that Meghan and Harry would be spending Christmas with Meghanâ€™s mom, Doria Ragland, instead of at Sandringham with the royal fam. They tried to downplay the drama, saying, â€œThis decision is in line with precedent set previously by other members of the Royal Family and has the support of Her Majesty the Queen,â€ but sources said thereâ€™s more to the story.

â€œThe rift between William and Harry is one of the main reasons behind their decision. As itâ€™s Archieâ€™s first Christmas, they want it to be super special. Itâ€™ll be just Doria and the three of them,â€ a source told Us Weekly following Buckingham Palaceâ€™s formal mid-month announcement. â€œThe drama surrounding the couple has caused a huge amount of stress. Theyâ€™re making their family their number one priority right now.â€

January 2020

Meghan and Harry announced theyâ€™d be stepping back from their senior royal duties, adding even more fuel to the feud fire. A source told Us Weekly that â€œWilliam was blindsided by Harry and Meghanâ€™s decision and statementâ€ and â€œthereâ€™s still a rift between the two brothers. Itâ€™s sad because when they were younger, William would be the first person Harry would go to with big news like this.â€

But the brothers tried to keep things calm, issuing this joint statement (which alluded to reports of William â€œbullyingâ€ Harry out of the fam):

â€œDespite clear denials, a false story ran in a UK newspaper today speculating about the relationship between The Duke of Sussex and The Duke of Cambridge. For brothers who care so deeply about the issues surrounding mental health, the use of inflammatory language in this way is offensive and potentially harmful.â€

March 2020

Tension was on full display during Meghan and Harryâ€™s final appearance with William and Kate at the Commonwealth Day Service. Body-language expert Blanca Cobb analyzed their collective interactions and thought they were â€œlackluster among the four of them, particularly Kateâ€™s lack of acknowledgment.â€

But toward the end of the month, Harry and Williamâ€™s relationship seemingly began to improve as the Sussexes prepared to officially step back from the royal family. According to a report from the Daily Mail, the brothers were on speaking terms again and both agreed to do their part with helping out their homeland in the pandemic.

June 2020

Just when we thought things were starting to turn around, Us dropped another reportâ€”this time claiming that William was still annoyed with Harryâ€™s decision to up and leave England (here we go again).

â€œWilliam is so tired and done with the drama of it all,â€ the source said. â€œSeeing Harry cut ties with virtually every aspect of his English life and identity is so hard to fathom.â€

July 2020

Finding Freedomâ€”a biography about the Duke and Duchess of Sussex by royal reporters Omid Scobie and Carol Durandâ€”drops and gives more insight into the royal feud. Apparently, William told Harry that he needed to â€œtake as much time as you need to get to know this girlâ€ when it came to Meghan, which Harry didnâ€™t take very kindly to.

August 2020

William and Harry kicked off the month on speaking terms, but royal author Phil Dampier told New Idea (via the Daily Mail) that conversations were â€œstilted and difficult.â€

September 2020

After a relatively quiet month of no big royal family events, huge news dropped: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle signed a multimillion-dollar deal with Netflix. The news probably wouldnâ€™t ruffle feathers, except for the fact that Netflix is responsible for The Crown, which the royal fam has veryâ€¦mixed feelings about.

According to the Sun, Prince William was especially unhappy with Harry over it. â€œWilliam and other senior royals are incredibly uncomfortable about this drama and livid Harry is now in partnership with the company thatâ€™s airing it.â€

On top of all this, Robert Laceyâ€™s book Battle of Brothers comes out, and it gives more insight into William and Harryâ€™s feud. Lacey claims William actually went ahead and got Princess Dianaâ€™s brother Charles Spencer involved in how fast Harry was moving with Meghan, and Harry wasâ€¦notâ€¦thrilled.

â€œThe result of the Spencer intervention was an even more bitter explosion,â€ an excerpt from the book published by the Daily Mail reads. â€œOnce again, Harry refused to slow down. He didnâ€™t blame his uncle. He understood why Dianaâ€™s brother should want to help. Yet he was furious with his elder brother for dragging other family members into the row. The fraternal fissure became established. There would be patch-ups and reconciliations, especially when a public show of unity was required. But that anger and mistrustâ€”that distanceâ€”has lasted to the present day.â€

The book also claimed Harry was â€œfighting back tearsâ€ during one particular â€œroyal snubâ€ by his brother during one of their final royal events together.

October 2020

Robert Lacey released another excerpt of his book Battle of Brothers publicly and this time alleged that William and Harry had a â€œshowdownâ€ over Meghan being involved in British Vogueâ€™s Forces of Change issue because not all the content was impartial.

Per the Mirror, Lacey claimed it was â€œanother classic Harry explosion, followed by a further, even deeper rift.â€

Separately, Lacey claimed William took this picture to send a â€œmessageâ€ to Harry:

And it kinda worked. the Times claims Harry and Meghan were indeed upset and saw it as a â€œsignal that they were being excluded from royal life.â€

November 2020

According to the Sunday Times (via People), Harry asked to have a wreath of poppies laid on his behalf on Remembrance Day, but the request was turned down by courtiers because he doesnâ€™t represent the royals in an official capacity anymore. (FYI, the Queen was apparently not aware of Harryâ€™s request.)

Either way, Harry was said to be â€œdeeply saddenedâ€ by the decision, and he and Meghan Markle went ahead and visited the Los Angeles National Cemetery in order to lay flowers at the graves of two Commonwealth soldiers.

March 2021

Behold: the big tell-all interview between Meghan, Harry, and Oprah. In March 2021, the Sussexes sat down to talk candidly about what happened during their time as working royals, and it was illuminating.

While Harry didnâ€™t go all in, he did talk about the tension between himself and his older brother, saying, â€œAs Iâ€™ve said before, I love William to bits. Heâ€™s my brother. Weâ€™ve been to hell together. But weâ€™re on different paths.â€

â€œThe relationship is â€˜spaceâ€™ at the moment,â€ he continued. â€œAnd time heals all things, hopefully.â€

As for Williamâ€™s response, in an interview with Entertainment Tonight, Katie Nicholl said â€œWilliam is devastated by this interview,â€ adding, â€œDonâ€™t forget that the Duchess of Cambridge is being dragged into this whole saga and William will hate that andâ€¦relationship between father and son is of course at an all-time low. I think that the idea that Kateâ€™s being dragged into this will be upsetting for Kate, who behind the scenes has tried really hard to be a peacemaker between William and Harry. She has been deeply saddened by the brothersâ€™ falling-out. Donâ€™t forget she was incredibly close to Harry herself.â€

A source also told Us Weekly that Will (as well as Kate) were â€œin total shock after hearing what Meghan and Harry said in the tell-all. After all this drama, a reporter asked William, â€œHave you spoken to your brother since the interview?â€ to which he responded, â€œNo, I havenâ€™t spoken to him yet, but I will.â€ A second reporter then asked William, â€œCan you just let me know, is the royal family a racist family, sir?â€ and he said â€œWeâ€™re very much not a racist family.â€

Gayle King also hopped on CBS This Morning to give an update on Harry and Williamâ€™s relationship, saying they havenâ€™t made much progress. â€œI did actually call them [Harry and Meghan] to see how they were feeling, and itâ€™s true, Harry has talked to his brother and he has talked to his father too,â€ Gayle says. â€œThe word I was given was that those conversations were not productive. But they are glad that they have at least started a conversation. And I think what is still upsetting to them is the Palace keeps saying they want to work it out privately, but yet they believe these false stories are coming out that are very disparaging against Meghan, still.â€

April 2021

Amid Prince Philipâ€™s funeral, things between Harry and William remained â€œextremely frosty.â€

â€œTruth be told, Harry didnâ€™t really know what to expect before he came home, which is why he reached out before seeing everyone,â€ a source told the Mirror. â€œHe wrote a deeply personal note to his dad to try and set things straight but tensions are still running high and things havenâ€™t exactly ironed out the way he had hoped.â€

â€œHarry didnâ€™t expect everything to be completely back to normal but his feeling after seeing his family was there is a lot of ground to make up,â€ the source continued. â€œWhether that is harder or easier to do on the other side of the world remains to be seen. There is a lot of distrust in the camp and everything is still very, very raw.â€

May 2021

With Princess Dianaâ€™s statue unveiling around the corner, the Palace is concerned about William and Harryâ€™s body language. â€œThe brothers will be physically together for the ceremony but want to make their own personal addresses,â€ a source told the Sun, via Page Six. â€œYou might have thought theyâ€™d go for a joint statement and speech, but thatâ€™s not the case. Each has insisted on preparing their own. It is a big concern that their body language will suggest all is not well and they wonâ€™t present a united front.â€

July 2021

Princess Dianaâ€™s statue unveiling was a reunion of sorts for the brothers, and the day went as planned.

â€œWilliam and Harry spent the morning before the statue unveiling looking through old keepsakes, notes from Diana and bonding,â€ an Us source said. â€œThey have absolutely turned a new page in their relationship and have started the healing. Everyone around them was thrilled to see how close they were on the day of the statue unveiling.â€

September 2021

In an interview with ET Online, royal author and expert Omid Scobie explained that there were â€œstill feelings of angerâ€ toward Harry and Meghan about the â€œway the couple carried out their departure from their royal livesâ€ and that Will in particular â€œhas not been able to come to termsâ€ with the whole situation yet.

â€œThe relationship between Harry and William is still very much one of distance,â€ Scobie said. â€œI donâ€™t just mean physical [distance], across the Atlantic, but they are not talking that much, and that is exactly how sources close to William have put it.â€

December 2021

A source told People that Kate has been â€œreally, really upsetâ€ about the royal feud, while a friend added, â€œEverything with Harry and Meghan has been hugely stressful, but if anything, itâ€™s pulled [her and William] closer together. She was upset about it because [William] was so upset. Seeing her husband so distraught was tough.â€

January 2022

Penguin announced that Prince Harry is working on a memoir.

April 2022

Prince Harry reportedly suggested that a mediator be brought in to work with him and Prince William on their relationship. Katie Nicholl laid out the details to Entertainment Tonight, saying, â€œHarry, Iâ€™m told, suggested perhaps that they might get some sort of a mediator in on sort of these talks, to make some progress. It was something that he had suggested to his father. Heâ€™s made it very clear that he wants to sort things out. He wants things to be improved.â€

Meanwhile, Harry was asked if he â€œmissedâ€ his brother and dad during a Today interview with Hoda Kotb, and he dodged the question, saying, â€œLook, I mean, for me at the moment, Iâ€™m here focused on these guys [athletes at the Invictus Games] and these families and giving everything that I can, 120 percent, to them to make sure they have the experience of a lifetime. Thatâ€™s my focus here. And then I leave here, I get back and my focus is on my family, who I miss massivelyâ€¦[Archie and Lilibet] are two little people, you know?â€

May 2022

Amid news that Harry and Meghan will be attending the Queenâ€™s Platinum Jubilee, royal expert Richard Fitzwilliams tells Us Weekly that Harry and Williamâ€™s â€œrift very definitely hasnâ€™t been healedâ€ and that Harryâ€™s upcoming memoir continues to cause tension, saying, â€œIt will again be a source of very, very substantial discord. Whatever he writes, if itâ€™s published this year, itâ€™s going to cause problems.â€

That said, The Mirror reports that the brothers have been texting regularly and holding weekly FaceTimes with their kids, â€œwhich has allowed them to re-bond,â€ so it seems like things are maybe looking up?

June 2022

Scratch that! It looks like William and Harry didnâ€™t get a chance to re-bond at the Jubilee after all, as a source told Page Six things were â€œfrostyâ€ between them. On top of that, the Cambridges missed Lilibetâ€™s 1st birthday party at Frogmore Cottage because of a trip to Wales.

A source told the Daily Mail that Harry and Williamâ€™s relationship following the Jubilee is still at â€œrock bottomâ€ and William has a lot of angst about his brother.

â€œHe alternates between grieving for what he has lost and feeling really, really angry about what his brother has done,â€ says a friend of Williamâ€™s. â€œHe truly loves Harry and feels he has lost the only person, aside from his wife, who understood this strange life of theirs. But he believes there are things you just donâ€™t do. And Harry has 100 percent crossed that line.â€

Meanwhile, an Us Weekly insider said William â€œdoesnâ€™t know who [Harry] is anymore and the trust between them is strained,â€ also noting that their bond is â€œdoomedâ€ and â€œirreparable.â€ Okay!

August 2022

Prince William doesnâ€™t appear to be thrilled about Harryâ€™s upcoming memoir, and a source told The Sun that heâ€™s refusing to see his brother until the book comes out later this year. And itâ€™s not just Wills. Apparently, senior royals are â€œkeen to avoidâ€ the Sussexes until the memoir, but William specifically â€œfeels he cannot trust his younger brother not to repeat their conversations.â€

September 2022

News of Meghanâ€™s interview with The Cut all but broke the internet when it was published, and the royal family had ~opinions~ about itâ€¦well, ones that will probs never be admitted to the public, that is. TL;DR: Insiders said they were definitely not pleased. A source told Entertainment Tonight that the â€œroyal family is disappointed by Meghan Markleâ€™s latest comments in The Cut magazine and on her podcast. They are distressed that after stepping back from the royal familyâ€”claiming a need for privacyâ€”she continues to publicize family matters in public.â€ The source also added there is a â€œloss of trustâ€ with Meghan. Oof.

Despite all of the seemingly endless drama, we do think that maybe the families will end up setting their differences aside in the wake of Queen Elizabeth IIâ€™s saddening deathâ€”after all, they already reunited to view floral tributes after Prince William reached out to his brother:

December 2022

Truly a rough month for Harry and Williamâ€™s relationship. On top of the brothers failing to connect during William and Kateâ€™s official trip to Boston, Harry and Meghan went ahead and released the trailer for their Netflix docuseries. Actually, they released several trailersâ€”the first of which dropped during the Cambridgesâ€™ trip to Boston.

When volume 1 of the series finally aired on December 8, Meghan and Harry mostly talked about the beginning of their â€™ship and their adorable engagement, but Harry did seemingly make a comment about his brotherâ€¦and his dad, for that matter. He said:

â€œFor so many people in the family, especially obviously the men, there can be a temptation or an urge to marry someone who would fit the mold as opposed to somebody who you are perhaps destined to be with. The difference between making decisions with your head or your heart. My mom certainly made most of her decisions, if not all of them, from her heart, and I am my motherâ€™s son.â€

Meghan talked about the Cambridges directly, recalling the first time she met Kate at Prince Harryâ€™s house: â€œEven when Will and Kate came over and I met her for the first time, they came over for dinner, I remember I was in ripped jeans and I was barefoot,â€ she said. â€œLike, I was a hugger; Iâ€™ve always been a hugger. I didnâ€™t realize that that is really jarring for a lot of Brits. I guess I started to understand really quickly that the formality on the outside carried through on the inside.â€

Meanwhile, the Cambridges didn't release a statement about the show, but Prince William was said to be â€œvery, very angry at his brotherâ€ over the series, soâ€¦Â¯\_(ãƒ„)_/Â¯.

Finally, volume 2 of Harry & Meghan, which dropped on December 15, introduced quiiiiite a few more tidbits re: Will and Kateâ€”namely that the Duke of Cambridge allegedly shouted at Harry, that the Palace issued a fake joint statement and was â€œhappy to lie to protect [William], and that for three years, they were never willing to tell the truth to protect [Harry and Meghan].â€ Oh, and that there may have been some jealousy because of Meghanâ€™s popularity. For a more in-depth look at *all* the bombshells from the final three episodes of the series, check out this story:

January 2023

Prince Harryâ€™s memoir, Spare, droppedâ€”and in it, he accused William of physically attacking him during a fight about Meghan Markle.

â€œHe set down the water, called me another name, then came at me. It all happened so fast. So very fast. He grabbed me by the collar, ripping my necklace, and he knocked me to the floor. I landed on the dogâ€™s bowl, which cracked under my back, the pieces cutting into me. I lay there for a moment, dazed, then got to my feet and told him to get out.â€

Amid the bookâ€™s release, a source told Us Weekly, â€œAt this point, [Williamâ€™s] got no plans to speak to Harry. Heâ€™s come to terms with the fact [that] heâ€™s lost his little brother and quite possibly for life.â€

The insider also said that Wills â€œdoesnâ€™t even recognize his own brother anymoreâ€ and wants to believe thereâ€™s â€œhope for peace down the line, but itâ€™s hard.â€

February 2023

A month after the release of Spare, William and Harry still arenâ€™t speaking, with a source telling Us Weekly that William â€œhas made no effort to speak to Harryâ€ and â€œfeels that Harry is all smoke and mirrors and is not to be trusted. Heâ€™s trying to move on with his life.â€

Oh, AND a source tells the Daily Mail (sorry, sources were VERY chatty during this time) that the situation has become a â€œtoxic stalemateâ€ and that â€œWilliam has no intention whatsoever of apologizing and remains incandescent, especially around the way his wife, the Princess of Wales, has been treated. The relationship isnâ€™t even rock bottom nowâ€”itâ€™s nonexistent. And I just donâ€™t see if Harry were to come to the coronation how William could even bring himself to look his brother in the face.â€

March 2023

News breaks that Meghan and Harry have been evicted from Frogmore Cottage, and according to the Sun, King Charlesâ€™ decision to oust them was â€œbackedâ€ by Queen Camilla as well as William and Kate. Yiiiiikes.

April 2023

Amid news that Prince Harry is attending the coronation, the Telegraph reported that he and Charles have been holding â€œpeace talks,â€ which William wants literally nothing to do with. Meanwhile, sources tell the Daily Mail that other royal family members have â€œno interestâ€ in speaking to Harry beyond â€œthe most basic of greetingsâ€ and that William specifically has â€œno plans to speak to him.â€

June 2023

A painting of Prince Harry and Prince William in the National Portrait Gallery was removed in a truly not-shocking-yet-totally-shocking move. According to the Times, the portrait, which was done by Nicky Philipps, was first unveiled in 2010 and garnered tons of praise at the time. However, now it is more so â€œregarded as a painful reminder of the rift at the heart of the royal family,â€ especially for Kate, who is a patron of the establishment.

That said!!! Itâ€™s important to note that all of this is speculation and the National Portrait Gallery itself has yet to offer a specific reason as to why the painting is no longer there. Instead, all a gallery spokesperson mentioned was that â€œdecisions relating to the portraits on display at the National Portrait Gallery are made by the galleryâ€™s curatorial team. With over 250,000 portraits in our collection, we are only able to display a small percentage within our building; however, as one of the worldâ€™s largest and most important collections of portraits, we regularly lend and tour our works, both nationally and internationally. This portrait by Nicky Philipps was included in a touring exhibitionâ€”Tudors to Windsorsâ€”which traveled between 2018 and 2021. The portrait was last displayed at the gallery between March and August 2018.â€

Oh, and Kensington Palace says the decision wasnâ€™t at their request, so Â¯\_(ãƒ„)_/Â¯.

August 2023

On top of the royals failing to wish Meghan happy birthday on social media (a definite departure from years prior), the Sun reported that the Sussexes haven't been invited to a royal gathering in Balmoral marking the one-year anniversary of the Queen's passing. As a source puts it, â€œthe Sussexes have not been invited despite being in Europe for the Invictus Games a day after the anniversary.â€

Meanwhile, royal author Robert Jobson told the Express that Kate is pretty much the only royal invested in getting Harry and William back on speaking terms, saying â€œI think the only person that is helping the situation is Catherine.â€

November 2023

Royal reporter Omid Scobie revealed that things between Harry and William are still not great, telling People that â€œabsolutely nothing has changed."

â€œI saw Harryâ€™s release of Spare as his last attempt at telling his family how heâ€™s felt for years,â€ Scobie mused. â€œBecause clearly thereâ€™s never been an open enough forum to have these conversations or share these feelings.â€

He added, â€œI was talking to a source quite early on in the process, and they called Harry a â€˜defectorâ€™ and said that was Williamâ€™s view. These were two men who once upon a time were firmly aligned in their outlook. One of them had to move on to also protect the crown.â€

Meanwhile, Scobie said â€œthere's no going backâ€ for the brothers, and noted that â€œIn the eyes of some within the institution, Harry is a threat to the crown. His freedom to exert his own thinking outside of the confines of the institution has made him the enemy.â€

February 6, 2024

Just one day after His Majesty's cancer diagnosis was made public, Harry went ahead and visited him in the United Kingdom. However...there were â€œno plansâ€ for him to see his estranged brother Prince William. Yikes.

February 7, 2024

An insider chatted with the Mirror, and dished that though there were â€œno plansâ€ to see Prince William on his trip to the U.K., Harry would be open to it: â€œThe Duke's primary reason to travel to the UK is to visit his father. If the opportunity were to arise to see the Prince of Wales then the Duke would have gladly accepted it.â€

How-ev-er!!! Apparently, Prince William wouldn't be here for it anyway. ğŸ‘€

According to an â€œold school friendâ€ of the brothers (who has â€œremained loyal to Williamâ€), â€œThe news about their father is absolutely shocking, but I donâ€™t think it means William wants to meet up with Harry and shake hands for the cameras.
